metadata.title: CVE-2016-9310 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The control mode (mode 6) functionality in ntpd in NTP before 4.2.8p9allows remote attackers to set or unset traps via a crafted control modepacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9310` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p9+dfsg-2ubuntu1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p9+dfsg-2ubuntu1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p9+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p9+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
